description: Describes one or more of your service deployments. A service deployment happens when you release a software update for the service. For more information, see View service history using Amazon ECS service deployments.

nested_items.name: serviceDeployments
nested_items.description: The list of service deployments described.

nested_items.name: serviceDeploymentArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the service deployment.

nested_items.name: serviceArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the service for this service deployment.

nested_items.name: clusterArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the cluster that hosts the service.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The time the service deployment was created. The format is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSSSSS.

nested_items.name: startedAt
nested_items.description: The time the service deployment statred. The format is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSSSSS.

nested_items.name: finishedAt
nested_items.description: The time the service deployment finished. The format is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSSSSS.

nested_items.name: stoppedAt
nested_items.description: The time the service deployment stopped. The format is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSSSSS.
A user manually stops the deployment.
The rollback option is not in use for the failure detection mechanism (the circuit breaker or alarm-based) and the service fails.

nested_items.name: updatedAt
nested_items.description: The time that the service deployment was last updated. The format is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSSSSS.

nested_items.name: sourceServiceRevisions
nested_items.description: The currently deployed workload configuration.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the service revision.

nested_items.name: requestedTaskCount
nested_items.description: The number of requested tasks for the service revision.

nested_items.name: runningTaskCount
nested_items.description: The number of running tasks for the service revision.

nested_items.name: pendingTaskCount
nested_items.description: The number of pending tasks for the service revision.

nested_items.name: targetServiceRevision
nested_items.description: The workload configuration being deployed.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the service revision.

nested_items.name: requestedTaskCount
nested_items.description: The number of requested tasks for the service revision.

nested_items.name: runningTaskCount
nested_items.description: The number of running tasks for the service revision.

nested_items.name: pendingTaskCount
nested_items.description: The number of pending tasks for the service revision.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The service deployment state.

nested_items.name: statusReason
nested_items.description: Information about why the service deployment is in the current status. For example, the circuit breaker detected a failure.

nested_items.name: deploymentConfiguration
nested_items.description: Optional deployment parameters that control how many tasks run during a deployment and the ordering of stopping and starting tasks.

nested_items.name: deploymentCircuitBreaker
nested_items.description: The deployment circuit breaker determines whether a service deployment will fail if the service can't reach a steady state. If you use the deployment circuit breaker, a service deployment will transition to a failed state and stop launching new tasks. If you use the rollback option, when a service deployment fails, the service is rolled back to the last deployment that completed successfully. For more information, see Rolling update in the Amazon Elastic Container Service Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: enable
nested_items.description: Determines whether to use the deployment circuit breaker logic for the service.

nested_items.name: rollback
nested_items.description: Determines whether to configure Amazon ECS to roll back the service if a service deployment fails. If rollback is on, when a service deployment fails, the service is rolled back to the last deployment that completed successfully.

nested_items.name: maximumPercent
nested_items.description: If a service is using the rolling update ( ECS) deployment type, the maximumPercent parameter represents an upper limit on the number of your service's tasks that are allowed in the RUNNING or PENDING state during a deployment, as a percentage of the desiredCount (rounded down to the nearest integer). This parameter enables you to define the deployment batch size. For example, if your service is using the REPLICA service scheduler and has a desiredCount of four tasks and a maximumPercent value of 200%, the scheduler may start four new tasks before stopping the four older tasks (provided that the cluster resources required to do this are available). The default maximumPercent value for a service using the REPLICA service scheduler is 200%.

nested_items.name: minimumHealthyPercent
nested_items.description: If a service is using the rolling update ( ECS) deployment type, the minimumHealthyPercent represents a lower limit on the number of your service's tasks that must remain in the RUNNING state during a deployment, as a percentage of the desiredCount (rounded up to the nearest integer). This parameter enables you to deploy without using additional cluster capacity. For example, if your service has a desiredCount of four tasks and a minimumHealthyPercent of 50%, the service scheduler may stop two existing tasks to free up cluster capacity before starting two new tasks.
A service is considered healthy if all essential containers within the tasks in the service pass their health checks.

If a task has no essential containers with a health check defined, the service scheduler will wait for 40 seconds after a task reaches a RUNNING state before the task is counted towards the minimum healthy percent total.

If a task has one or more essential containers with a health check defined, the service scheduler will wait for the task to reach a healthy status before counting it towards the minimum healthy percent total. A task is considered healthy when all essential containers within the task have passed their health checks. The amount of time the service scheduler can wait for is determined by the container health check settings.

nested_items.name: alarmNames
nested_items.description: One or more CloudWatch alarm names. Use a ',' to separate the alarms.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: rollback
nested_items.description: Determines whether to configure Amazon ECS to roll back the service if a service deployment fails. If rollback is used, when a service deployment fails, the service is rolled back to the last deployment that completed successfully.

nested_items.name: enable
nested_items.description: Determines whether to use the CloudWatch alarm option in the service deployment process.

nested_items.name: reason
nested_items.description: The reason the rollback happened. For example, the circuit breaker initiated the rollback operation.

nested_items.name: startedAt
nested_items.description: Time time that the rollback started. The format is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSSSSS.

nested_items.name: serviceRevisionArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the service revision deployed as part of the rollback.

nested_items.name: deploymentCircuitBreaker
nested_items.description: The circuit breaker configuration that determines a service deployment failed.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The circuit breaker status. Amazon ECS is not using the circuit breaker for service deployment failures when the status is DISABLED.

nested_items.name: failureCount
nested_items.description: The number of times the circuit breaker detected a service deploymeny failure.

nested_items.name: threshold
nested_items.description: The threshhold which determines that the service deployment failed.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the alarms check. Amazon ECS is not using alarms for service deployment failures when the status is DISABLED.

nested_items.name: alarmNames
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch alarms that determine when a service deployment failed. A ',' separates the alarms.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: triggeredAlarmNames
nested_items.description: One or more CloudWatch alarm names that have been triggered during the service deployment. A ',' separates the alarm names.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: failures
nested_items.description: Any failures associated with the call.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the failed resource.

nested_items.name: reason
nested_items.description: The reason for the failure.

nested_items.name: detail
nested_items.description: The details of the failure.
